ARTICLE V. - CITY BOARDS AND COMMISSIONS[12] 
Footnotes: 
--- (12) --- 
Cross reference- Board of appeals,  6-38 et seq.; residential rental occupancy board of appeals,  6-76; traffic commission,  20-48. 

DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY[13] 

Footnotes: 
--- (13) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 3940,  1, adopted April 10, 1978, added  2-103.1, entitled "Generally" to the Code; for purposes of classification and in order to preserve Code format, the editor has redesignated the provisions as  2-103.51, and added it as part of Div. 1, "Generally," in Art. V. 

Sec. 2-103.51. - Terms of office; removal from office. 
    There shall be no limit on the number of terms which may be served by a member of any city board, committee or commission, except as such service may be restricted by the statutes of the State of Missouri; except that such service may be further limited by the following provisions: 
(a)  Every member of every board, commission or committee of the City of Liberty shall be present and answer the roll call for every official regular meeting of such board, commission or committee, provided that such member may be excused from attendance at any specific meeting of any such board, commission or committee, if he shall first notify the chairman of such board, commission or committee of the reason for such absence, and such reason and notification shall be recorded in the official minutes of said board, commission or committee, and certified to the clerk of the city council following each such meeting; except that should any member of any board, commission or committee be incapacitated through injury or illness, without advance warning, a suspension of this rule shall be in effect until such time as said member is able to determine his ability and willingness to continue service on such board, commission or committee. 
(b)  Should any member of any board, commission or committee fail to be in attendance at three (3) consecutive regular meetings of any such board, commission or committee without meeting the requirements of subsection (a) of this section, such member shall be subject to automatic termination of his term of office, and removal from such board, commission or committee, and shall be so notified by the clerk of the city council; provided that any such member so terminated shall have the right, upon written request within ten (10) days of such notification of termination, to appeal to the mayor and city council for reconsideration of such termination because of extenuating circumstances, which such extenuating circumstances shall be set forth in the written request for such appeal. 
(Ord. No. 3940,  1, 4-10-78) 
DIVISION 1A. - PLANNING AND ZONING COMMISSION[14] 

Footnotes: 
--- (14) --- 
Cross reference- Planning and zoning commission (Unified Development Ordinance),  30-19 et seq. 

Sec. 2-104. - Composition; qualifications; appointment. 
    The city planning and zoning commission shall be composed of nine (9) members, all of whom shall be freeholders and residents of the city, who shall be qualified by knowledge or experience to act in matters pertaining to the development of a city plan, and who shall not hold any other office in the city government, and who shall be appointed by the mayor, with the approval and consent of a majority of the city council. 
(2204,  1) 
Sec. 2-105. - Terms of office; vacancies; compensation. 
    The members of the city planning and zoning commission appointed by the mayor shall hold office, respectively, as follows: three (3) members for a term of one year; three (3) members for a term of two (2) years; three (3) members for a term of three (3) years; from and after January 1, 1963; and annually thereafter on or before the first day of January of each year, the mayor, with the approval and consent of a majority of the city council, shall appoint three (3) members to fill the vacancy caused by the expiration of the above terms. 
    Should any vacancy exist or occur in the city planning and zoning commission, the mayor with the approval and consent of a majority of the city council, shall fill such vacancy by appointment for the remainder of the term of the member creating the vacancy. The members of the commission shall serve without compensation or pay. 
(2204,  2) 
Sec. 2-106. - Meetings; organization; quorum. 
    The city planning and zoning commission shall meet on the second Tuesday of each month in the City Hall at 7:00 p.m. At the first regular meeting of the commission as hereby composed, the commission shall choose one of its members to act as chairman and another of its members to act as vice-chairman. The terms of such officers shall be for one year; and at the first regular meeting of the commission after the first day of January in each year, the commission shall elect a chairman and a vice-chairman to act for the next year. The commission shall select a suitable person to act as secretary. The minutes of each meeting shall be filed in the office of the city clerk. A majority of the members of the commission shall constitute a quorum and no action of the commission shall be binding unless authorized by a majority of the commission at a regular meeting or at a duly called special meeting thereof. Special meetings may be called by the chairman or by any two (2) members of the commission upon giving written notice to the members of the commission at least three (3) days before the date of such special meeting. The commission shall have power to make rules and regulations for the proper conduct of its business. 
(2204,  3; 2335,  1; 2915,  1; Ord. No. 5137,  1, 5-12-86; Ord. No. 8276,  I, 12-10-01; Ord. No. 8904,  I, 11-28-05) 
Sec. 2-107. - Public hearings. 
    The city planning and zoning commission shall hold public hearings on requests for changes in any planning and zoning ordinance which may be enacted to cover the city as a whole, and shall make a report in writing to the city council of its recommendation concerning such application for a change. The city planning and zoning commission shall also hold public hearings on any changes in the zoning ordinance proposed by the commission itself and make recommendations to the council thereof. 
(2204,  4) 
Sec. 2-108. - Power to make surveys, maps, etc. 
    The city planning and zoning commission shall have full power and authority to make or cause to be made, surveys of the city, maps, plans or charts of the whole or any part of the city and of any land outside the city which, in the opinion of the commission, bears relation to the plan of the city. The commission shall request the city council to contract for any technical, professional or consulting services which the commission considers necessary in its work and which services it considers are not available through the city staff. All funds expended by the commission shall be approved by the city council before any commitment for the expenditures of funds is made by the commission. 
(2204,  5) 
Sec. 2-109. - Fees for rezoning applications filed with commission. 
    Any application filed with the planning and zoning commission for the rezoning of any property after the passage of this section shall be accompanied by an application fee as identified in the City of Liberty Fee Schedule. 
(2418,  2; 2990,  2; Ord. No. 10946,  VI, 8-27-18) 
DIVISION 2. - PARK BOARD 

Sec. 2-110. - Created; composition; qualifications; terms of office. 
    There is created a park board for the city consisting of nine (9) directors, all to be citizens and residents of the city and each to serve for a period of three (3) years; excepting, that only at the time of the appointment of the first board, three (3) directors shall be appointed for a one-year term, three (3) directors for a two-year term and three (3) directors for a three-year term. 
Sec. 2-111. - Appointment; compensation; organization; vacancies, etc. 
    All appointments to the park board shall be made by the mayor and approved by the city council as required by state law. Each director shall serve until his successor is duly appointed and qualified, and shall receive no compensation. Immediately after appointment of the directors, there shall be an organizational meeting of the board at which time the directors shall elect from among their number a president, and such other officers as may be necessary, to serve for the ensuing year and until the election and qualification of their respective successors. Vacancies shall be filled in the same manner as regular appointments and any person so appointed shall serve the remainder of the unexpired term. 
    The park board shall make and adopt such bylaws, rules and regulations for their guidance and for the government of parks as may be expedient, not inconsistent with RSMo 90.500-90.570. 
Sec. 2-112. - Duties generally. 
    The park board shall have charge of all property which has been designated by the city council for park purposes. It shall be responsible for erection and maintenance of all recreational facilities on such properties, for policy recommendations concerning the various uses to which all city park land and property may be put, for the recommendation of all necessary rules and regulations for the proper management of the public park system, including the leasing of concessions, and the terms and charges of such leasing, if any, to be made therefor, and the scheduling of any athletic, social or recreational events and the time of such events; provided, however, that any and all such responsibilities which require the expenditure of funds, execution of contracts, or regulations which must be enacted by ordinance, shall be referred to the mayor and city council for consideration and action. 
(Ord. No. 4030,  1, 11-20-78) 
Sec. 2-113. - Funds. 
    All funds acquired by the city by the sale of bonds issued or tax assessments levied for park purposes and funds collected by the park board shall be turned over to the city treasurer and be placed by that officer in a separate fund to be designated "park fund." All withdrawals from such fund shall be by warrant as required by law for the expenditure of such funds and all expenditures shall be made in accordance with RSMo 90.550. 
DIVISION 3. - AREA PLANNING COMMISSION 

Sec. 2-114. - Participation by city. 
    The city does hereby adopt the concurrent resolution, "Concurrent resolution by municipalities and counties in the Kansas City, Missouri, area providing for the establishment of a Kansas City, Missouri, Area Planning Commission and defining the powers and duties of such planning commission," a copy of which is hereto attached and authorizes the mayor of the city to sign the same on behalf of the city. 
    The administrative officials of the city are authorized and instructed to cooperate and assist in carrying into effect the provisions of such concurrent resolution and to assist and cause the various departments of the city to assist in the appropriate activities relating thereto. 
(2420,  1, 2) 
Editor's note- The plan referred to above is not included herein, but may be found on file with the city. 
DIVISION 4. - BOARD OF ADJUSTMENTS[15] 

Footnotes: 
--- (15) --- 
Cross reference- Building code board of appeals,  6-38 et seq.; board of zoning adjustment (Unified Development Ordinance),  30-29 et seq. 

Sec. 2-115. - Created; composition; appointment of members. 
    There is hereby created a board of adjustments which shall consist of five (5) members who shall be appointed by the mayor with the approval and consent of a majority of the city council. 
(1933,  5) 
Sec. 2-116. - Chairman. 
    The board of adjustments shall choose one of its members to act as chairman, to serve for a term of one year. 
(1933,  5) 
Sec. 2-117. - Term of members; filling vacancies. 
    Each member of the board of adjustments shall serve for five (5) years after the end of each of the staggered terms of the original members; provided, however, that any member appointed to fill a vacancy caused by any reason other than normal termination shall only serve for the remainder of the unexpired term. 
(1933,  5) 
Sec. 2-118. - Duties. 
    The board of adjustments shall pass upon all appeals from the director of building and zoning and shall have such other duties as may be delegated to it; provided, however, that a concurring vote of four (4) members shall be necessary to reverse any decision of the director of building and zoning. 
(1933,  5) 
Sec. 2-119. - Meetings; records to be kept. 
    The board of adjustments shall meet at such times as it may determine or upon call of the chairman; and it shall keep adequate records of its official actions. 
(1933,  5) 
Sec. 2-120. - Fees. 
    Any application made to the board of adjustments shall be accompanied by an application fee in the amount of one hundred dollars ($100.00). After a final determination has been made by the board on such application, the costs shall be determined and if such cost exceeds one hundred dollars ($100.00), the applicant shall pay such excess amount. No permits shall be issued until the fees herein provided have been paid in full. 
(2418,  1; 2990) 
DIVISION 5. - BOARD OF UTILITIES 

Sec. 2-121. - Composition, qualifications, appointment. 
    The board of utilities shall be composed of five (5) members, all of whom shall be residents of the city, and who shall be appointed by the mayor and approved by the city council. 
(3421) 
Sec. 2-122. - Terms of office, vacancies. 
    The members of the board of utilities shall hold office as follows: two (2) members for a term of two (2) years; three (3) members for a term of four (4) years. Following the original staggered terms, each member shall be appointed for four (4) years; provided, however, that any member appointed to fill a vacancy caused by any reason other than normal termination shall only serve for the remainder of the unexpired term. 
(3421) 
Sec. 2-123. - Meetings, organization, quorum. 
    The board of utilities shall meet at city hall at least once each quarter and oftener when circumstances dictate that more than one meeting be held in any given quarter. At the first regular meeting of the board, a chairman and vice-chairman shall be elected from its membership. At the first meeting of the board after the first of January in each year, the board shall elect a chairman and a vice-chairman to act for the next year. Staff assistance, including a secretary, shall be provided by the city administrator. Minutes of each meeting shall be filed in the office of the city clerk. Three (3) shall constitute a quorum to conduct business. 
(3421; Ord. No. 7571,  I, 11-24-97) 
Sec. 2-124. - Duties and responsibilities. 
    [The board of utilities:] 
(a)  Shall review and recommend to the mayor and city council the annual budget for the water and sewerage works system, which shall be submitted to the board by the city administrator. 
(b)  Shall review periodic reports of the financial condition of the water and sewerage works system to ensure that the required separation of funds is being followed and the accounting system within each fund is being maintained in a satisfactory manner. 
(c)  Shall review and recommend to the mayor and city council all capital improvements to the water and sewerage works system which shall be submitted to the board by the city administrator and director of utilities. 
(d)  Shall review and recommend to the mayor and city council all matters of policy, including agreements, contracts and code revisions, which shall be submitted to the board by the city administrator and director of utilities. 
(3421)

Footnotes:
