Sec. 28-4. - Taxicab code inapplicable to designated vehicles. 
    This Code shall not apply to motor vehicles engaged exclusively in the transportation of pupils to and from schools commonly known as school buses, nor to motor vehicles owned by any person used exclusively to transport his bona fide employees to and from the office or plant of such person, nor to motor buses engaged exclusively in interstate or interurban service under a certificate of convenience and necessity issued by the Public Service Commission of Missouri, nor to motor buses or trolley buses operated as a part of an urban or an interurban commuter system; and provided further that this chapter shall not apply to the operation of the Older Adults Transportation System (OATS), motor buses operated by churches for their exclusive benefit, charter buses, motor buses operated by nonprofit organizations for their exclusive benefit; nor shall it apply to the operations of any motor vehicles as common carriers of passengers for hire, where such passengers only alight from such motor vehicles within the city limits, and where such passengers are not transported from one point to another within said city limits. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-5. - Responsibility for enforcement. 
    The application of this chapter and the enforcement of its requirements shall be the responsibility of the licensing officer and the police department of the City of Liberty. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-6. - License-Required. 
    No persons shall engage in, operate or conduct a public taxicab business, a public taxicab or any vehicle for hire as defined in this chapter, within the city without first paying a license tax, and obtaining a license as provided by this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-7. - Same-Application; contents of application; fees. 
    Any person desiring to secure a license to engage in, operate or conduct a public taxicab business within the city shall file with the licensing officer a written application therefor, giving the following information. 
(a)  The full name and address of the applicant; if a partnership, the full name and address of all the partners; if a corporation, the full name and address of all officers and directors and the registered agent of the corporation; the trade name under which the applicant does or proposes to do business; and the address of the principal place of business of the applicant. 
(b)  The number of taxicabs actually owned by the applicant and the number held under lease, if any. 
(c)  The number of taxicabs the applicant will maintain in the City of Liberty during the time such license is in force. 
(d)  The applicant shall furnish to the licensing officer a certificate of current registration for each vehicle which will be operated within the City of Liberty, including evidence of compliance with the motor vehicle safety inspection requirements of Chapter 307, Revised Statutes of Missouri. 
    Such application shall be sworn to before a notary public or other officer duly authorized to administer oaths. Every application for a new license shall be accompanied by a twenty-five-dollar fee. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-8. - Missouri Motor Vehicle Safety Responsibility Law; compliance required. 
    Each licensee hereunder shall comply, at all times, with the Missouri Motor Vehicle Safety Responsibility Law (RSMo ch. 303) as to each vehicle used in such service prior to such use. Certificate of insurance or other certificate of the director of revenue of the State of Missouri of such compliance shall be filed by the licensee with the licensing officer of the city prior to placing such vehicle in service. At the time of application for such license, the applicant shall file such certificate of insurance or certificate of compliance with the licensing officer as to all vehicles initially intended to be used in such service, and thereafter as to any additional substitute or other vehicles used for such purpose. Failure of compliance upon any occasion shall terminate the license issued hereunder forthwith. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-9. - Application-Review and recommendation. 
    All such applications shall be reviewed by the licensing officer for compliance with this chapter and presented to the city council with a recommendation for approval or denial. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-10. - Same-Grant or denial by city council. 
    The city council shall, after reviewing any such application, determine the eligibility of the applicant, and in due course and without delay, grant or deny the application and issue or deny a license accordingly. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-11. - Same-Issuance of license. 
    After any applicant for a license as required under section 28-6 of this chapter has been granted such license by the city council, the licensing officer shall endorse upon the copy of the application "license approved," with a date of such approval. The licensing officer shall thereupon, upon the payment of the license tax, issue and deliver such license to the applicant. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-12. - Amount of tax. 
    Every person engaging in, operating or conducting a public taxicab business shall pay a license tax based upon section 18-16, "Schedule of fees," of Chapter 18, "Licenses," of the Code of the City of Liberty, Missouri. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-13. - Duration of license. 
    All licenses issued under the provisions in this chapter shall be for one year beginning on July 1st of the year issued and terminating on June 30th of the following year; provided, however, that any license not issued on July 1st shall be subject to the proration of fees as provided in section 18-5, "Term; proration of fees," of Chapter 18, "Licenses," of the Code of the City of Liberty, Missouri. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-14. - Schedule of rates. 
    Each taxicab company shall file a schedule of its taxicab fees with the licensing officer and shall not exceed the prices stated in this schedule without prior notice to the city council. These rates shall be displayed on a rate card within the plain view of the public within the taxicab. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-15. - Marking vehicles. 
    All vehicles used as a taxicab shall be plainly marked while so used with the name of the company and the word "taxicab," or "taxi," clearly visible on the exterior of the vehicle. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-16. - Inspections. 
    Every person who shall receive a license as defined in this chapter to operate taxicabs in the City of Liberty shall provide to the licensing officer evidence of a satisfactory inspection of each motor vehicle used as a taxicab under the rules and regulations of the Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law of the State of Missouri (RSMo 307.350 et seq.) as required in section 28-7 of this chapter, and display a current state registration as required by the Motor Vehicle Registration Law of the State of Missouri (RSMo ch. 301). The licensing officer shall reserve the right to inspect the taxicabs for cleanliness, proper display of the name of the taxicab company and the word "taxicab," or "taxi," prominently visible on the exterior of the vehicle, and for all other requirements under this chapter or under the Code of the City of Liberty; provided that all such inspections shall be made at a reasonable time consistent with the operation of taxicabs as required in this Code. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-17. - Violations; notice, report, correction. 
    If any violation of this Code shall be observed by any officer or employee of the city, he shall report said violation to the licensing officer; and it shall be the responsibility of the licensing officer to notify the owner, operator or driver of the taxicab involved therein by written notice that such violation shall be terminated and remedied immediately. If such violation is not remedied and terminated immediately, the licensing officer shall have the power to suspend such license or operator's permit, pending a hearing and formal action by the city council. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-18. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 4227,  1, enacted April 14, 1980, repealed  28-18, concerning the number of taxicab companies adequate for service, derived from  3 of Ord. No. 3950, adopted May 8, 1978. 
Sec. 28-19. - Revocation of license. 
    The license of any person shall be revoked by the city council for any of the following reasons, but the power of the city council to revoke a license shall not be exclusively limited thereto: 
(a)  Fraud. Whenever reasonably conclusive evidence shall be presented that such license issued hereunder has been obtained by misrepresentation of fraud. 
(b)  Failure to satisfy judgment. Whenever a certificate shall be received from any court or a clerk thereof, showing that such licensee shall have failed to satisfy within thirty (30) days of any final judgment, upon which execution has been lawfully issued against such licensee, or damages on account of bodily injury, including death, or damage to property resulting from the ownership, maintenance, use or operation of a taxicab. 
(c)  Use of unlicensed drivers. If the council is satisfied, after a proper hearing, that a holder of a license hereunder has employed or permitted an agent or an employee to hire or employ, as a taxicab driver or operator, any person not licensed as a taxicab driver or operator under the provisions of this Code, and has permitted such person to operate a taxicab for hire upon the streets of Liberty. 
(d)  Grounds requiring hearing. The holder of any license or permit under this chapter shall have the power to request a hearing before the city council to appeal any notice of revocation or revocation of any such license; provided such request shall be in writing and shall clearly state the reasons and circumstances for such request for hearing. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-20. - Qualifications of applicant for taxi operator's permit-Fee. 
    Every applicant for a taxi operator's permit shall: 
(a)  Be a citizen of the United States and over the age of eighteen (18) years. 
(b)  Be of sound physique, have good eyesight and not subject to epilepsy, vertigo, heart trouble or any other infirmity of mind or body which might render his unfit to drive or operate a taxicab safely on the streets of the city. 
(c)  Be able to read and write the English language. 
(d)  Be clean and neat in dress and person, and not addicted to the use of intoxicating liquor or drugs. 
(e)  Have a valid chauffeur's license issued by the State of Missouri. 
(f)  A fee shall be paid by the applicant, said fee based on the schedule of fees in full force and effect, having been approved by the city council and on file in the office of the deputy city clerk. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78; Ord. No. 8624,  III, 12-15-03) 
Sec. 28-21. - Same-Exceptions. 
    Any operator or driver who shall have a currently valid taxicab operator's permit issued by another city and which qualifies said operator or driver to drive the taxicab which said operator or driver proposes to drive in the City of Liberty, and which said city's criteria for issuance of such an operator's permit shall include the requirements for such a permit as listed in sections 28-20 and 28-22 of this chapter shall be eligible for such a permit issued by the City of Liberty upon presentation of such a valid operator's permit as described herein as a matter of right; provided that, should such operator or driver be found to be in violation of any of the provisions of this chapter, he shall be subject to the same revocation or suspension proceedings as any other operator or driver holding a permit under this chapter. The fee shall be waived for operators qualifying under this section. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-22. - Examination of applicant for a taxi operator's permit; expiration of permit. 
    After an application for a taxi operator's permit has been signed by the applicant and filed by him with the licensing officer, said application shall be forwarded to the chief of police of the city for investigation and report thereon. It shall also be necessary for the applicant to submit his fingerprints to the police department, and the signature of the applicant on the application shall constitute consent for an examination of the applicant's driving record and records of violations of any other law or ordinance of which the applicant shall have been convicted. No permit shall be issued to any applicant who shall have been convicted of driving while intoxicated or any offense related to the use of controlled substances within the five (5) years next preceding the date of the application, nor shall any permit be issued to any applicant who shall have been convicted of any felony offense or any offense against morals as defined in RSMo ch. 566, within the five (5) years next preceding the date of said application; provided that any applicant shall have the right to request a hearing before the city council, said request to be set forth in writing and stating the applicant's reasons for requesting such a hearing along with two (2) recommendations as to his current qualifications for being issued such a permit. All taxicab operators' permits shall expire three (3) years next succeeding the date of issuance. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-23. - Renewal of taxicab operator's permit. 
    A taxicab operator's permit may be renewed upon the written application of any permittee. Each renewal shall be investigated as provided in sections 28-20, 28-21 and 28-22 and a report thereon made to the licensing officer. Such application for renewal shall show thereon the date upon which the original license was granted. The term and fee for such renewal shall be the same as that of the original license. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-24. - False statement to secure taxi operator's permit. 
    Any false statement or misrepresentation of a material fact, made by an applicant for the purpose of securing a taxicab operator's permit, or any renewal thereof, shall be deemed good and sufficient cause for refusal to grant, or, if granted, for revocation of such permit. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-25. - Forging, altering taxi operator's permit, etc. 
    Any person who falsely or fraudulently shall make, forge, alter or counterfeit any taxicab operator's permit, or shall knowingly have in his possession or shall pass and/or tender any such instrument to any other person, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be fined not less than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor more than ninety dollars ($90.00), and shall not be eligible for a taxicab operator's permit for five (5) years next succeeding the date of such conviction. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-26. - Violations, notice, revocation of operator's permit. 
    Any holder of a taxicab operator's permit because [if] such permit holder shall not meet the requirements as set forth in sections 28-20, 28-21 and 28-22, shall have his operator's permit revoked, and notice of such revocation shall be transmitted by the licensing officer to both the licensee and the operator; provided that the provisions for a hearing as provided in section 28-21 shall be available to any operator whose operator's license shall be revoked under this section. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-27. - Transferability of licenses. 
    No owner or operator of a taxicab business may delegate his license privilege to any lessee or deferred-payment purchaser of any such taxicab business, except with the consent of the city council. All licenses issued or granted under this chapter shall be nonassignable and nontransferable without the consent of the city council. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-28. - Manifest; operator to keep. 
    Every operator of a taxicab within the City of Liberty shall keep and maintain a manifest as defined in section 28-1 of this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Sec. 28-29. - Violations; penalty. 
    Any operation by any person of a motor vehicle within the City of Liberty in violation hereof shall constitute a misdemeanor and shall be punishable by a fine of not less than twenty-five dollars ($25.00) nor more than ninety dollars ($90.00), and any such operation for each day shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. No. 3950,  3, 5-8-78) 
Chapter 28A - PUBLIC TREE CARE[1] 

Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 8755,  II, adopted Dec. 13, 2004, repealed former Ch. 28A,  28A-1-28A-4, in its entirety and enacted new provisions as herein set out. Former Ch. 28A pertained to similar subject matter and derived from Ord. No. 3086,  1-4. 

Sec. 28A-1. - Definitions. 
    As used in this section, the following words and terms shall have the meanings ascribed thereto: 
    City: The City of Liberty, Missouri, and includes any department or subdivision thereof. 
    Park trees: Trees and other woody vegetation on public park grounds, and those on areas owned or maintained by the city. 
    Prune: To alter, trim or cut a tree in accordance with generally accepted pruning techniques. 
    Removal: The actual removal or causing the effective removal through damaging, or other direct or indirect actions resulting in the death of trees. 
    Street trees: Trees and other woody vegetation on land lying between property lines on either side of all streets within the city. 
    Tree topping: The severe cutting back of limbs to stubs larger than three (3) inches in diameter within the tree's crown to such a degree so as to remove the normal canopy and disfigure the tree. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-2. - Purpose. 
    It is the purpose of this ordinance to promote and protect the public health, safety and general welfare by providing for the regulation of the planting, maintenance and removal of trees, shrubs and other plants within the City of Liberty, Missouri. It is also the purpose to create and maintain Liberty's urban forest in a strong, healthy condition for today and the future of Liberty, Missouri because of the many public benefits it provides. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-3. - Intent. 
    It is the intent of the Liberty City Council that the terms of this ordinance shall be construed so as to promote the planting, maintenance, restoration and survival of desirable trees, shrubs and other plants within the city. The intent is also the protection of community residents from personal injury and property damage and the protection of the City of Liberty from property damage, caused or threatened by the improper planting, maintenance, or removal of trees, shrubs or other plants located within the community. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-4. - Public tree care. 
    The city shall have the right to plant, prune, maintain and remove trees and/or other woody vegetation within the right-of-way lines of all Liberty streets and on public park grounds, or on areas owned or maintained by the city. This provision shall preserve and enhance the symmetry and beauty of such city-owned or maintained grounds. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-5. - Planting requirements. 
    The tree board will be charged with developing a policy for the planting of trees in public rights-of-way around structures including corners, fire hydrants, utilities, and curbs. The tree board will develop and maintain a list of desirable trees for planting along streets. A list of tree species not suitable for planting as street trees will also be created and maintained by the tree board. Should individuals request an exemption from the specifications, the tree board or its designee must approve it. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-6. - Pruning. 
(a)  Every owner of any tree overhanging any street or right-of-way within the city shall prune the branches so that such branches shall not obstruct the light from any street lamp or obstruct the view of any street intersection and so that there shall be a clear space of eight (8) feet above the surface of sidewalk. A clearance of twelve (12) feet must be maintained over streets and alleys. Property owners are responsible for trees on their own property. 
(b)  The city shall have the right to prune any tree or shrub on private property when it interferes with the proper spread of light along the street from a streetlight, interferes with visibility of any traffic control device or sign or poses a threat to public health, safety or general welfare. 
(c)  All pruning of city trees shall be done in accordance with the latest version of ANSI A300 Tree, Shrub and Other Woody Plant Maintenance Standard Practices. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-7. - Tree topping. 
    It shall be unlawful as a normal practice for any person, firm, or city department to top any street tree, park tree, or other tree on public property. Trees severely damaged by storms or other causes, or certain trees under utility wires or other obstruction where other pruning practices are impractical may be exempted from this section at the determination of the city administrator, who will advise the tree board or its designee of any such action. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-8. - Removal of dead and dying trees. 
    The city may remove, cause or order to be removed any tree or part thereof on public or private property which is in an unsafe condition or which by reason of its nature is injurious to electric power lines, other public improvements, or is seriously affected with any fatal pest or disease. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-9. - Enforcement. 
    The code enforcement officer shall have the duty to investigate complaints or information received concerning potential violations of this chapter, and determine whether enforcement is warranted under the provisions of this chapter and the policies established by the tree board. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04; Ord. No. 8796,  I, II, 3-28-05) 
Sec. 28A-10. - Penalty. 
    Any person who shall commit, assist in, or allow the existence of any violation of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and punished as provided in Chapter 22-70 of the Liberty City Code. For each and every day that a violation continues, it shall be deemed a separate offense, and punishable as a separate misdemeanor upon conviction. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Sec. 28A-11. - Appeal. 
    The appeal process shall be in accordance with Chapter 21, "Nuisances", of the Liberty City Code. 
(Ord. No. 8755,  II, 12-13-04) 
Chapter 29 - WATER AND SEWERS[1] 
Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Cross reference- Director of community development,  2-63, et seq.; director of public works,  2-68 et seq.; city engineer,  2-103.23 et seq.; board of utilities,  2-121 et seq.; buildings, Ch. 6; plumbing code,  6-13 et seq.; solid waste management, Ch. 17; public works, Ch. 23A; excavation,  25-24 et seq. 

ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 29-1. - "Developer" and "owner" defined. 
    The words "developer" and "owner" are to be construed to mean and include developer, subdivision owner, owner and other persons desiring water main extensions. 
(Ord. No. 2024,  10) 
Sec. 29-2. - Waterworks and sewerage system combined. 
    The city waterworks system as it now exists, and the city sewerage works system as it now exists shall henceforth be operated and maintained as a combined water and sewerage works system, and such combined system shall include all future improvements or extensions, whether to the waterworks or the sewerage works system, or to both, all pursuant to RSMo 250.020 and RSMo 250.030, Revised Statutes of Missouri. 
(Ord. No. 3422) 
Sec. 29-3. - Construction of private lines. 
    Any private sewer line or water line built with private funds where public facilities for the same are not provided, but where such private lines are connected onto public facilities, shall be constructed under the supervision and specifications of the utilities director in conjunction with the city engineer. 
(Ord. No. 1753; Ord. No. 3422) 
Sec. 29-4. - Size of private line. 
    The size of the line and the number of users that may be connected onto the line in the future shall be determined under specifications and supervision of the utilities director in conjunction with the city engineer, and the easement and bill of sale will so state that it is granted with the privilege of permitting a specified number of future users that may be connected onto the sewer line or water line. 
(Ord. No. 1753; Ord. No. 3422) 
Sec. 29-5. - Easement to city. 
    In order to carry out the provisions of section 29-2, the person constructing a sewer line or water line shall, upon completion of the line and before permission is granted to connect onto the public facilities, execute an easement for the right-of-way and a bill of sale vesting ownership, control and management of the line of the city. 
(Ord. No. 1753, 2) 
Sec. 29-5.1. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Sec. II of Ord. No. 10940, adopted July 30, 2018, repealed  29-5.1, which pertained to storm sewer specifications, and derived from Ord. 2843; and Ord. No. 6004, adopted Aug. 27, 1990. 
Sec. 29-5.2. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 6004,  3, adopted Aug. 27, 1990, amended the Code by deleting  29-5.2 in its entirety. Said section pertained to storm sewer design criteria and derived from Ord. No. 2844,  1 and 2. 
Sec. 29-5.3. - Books of account. 
    It shall be the duty of the finance director to keep books of accounts showing with entire accuracy contemporaneous current entries of the receipts and expenditures of such department, in such manner as to enable the same to be understood and investigated, and also to conform to standard accounting procedures, particularly as outlined in the revenue bond ordinances. All records books, warrants, and similar documents pertaining to the operation of the waterworks system shall at all times be available and open to examination by the city council and auditor and such reports as required by the city council shall be rendered as directed. 
(3422; Ord. No. 9901,  I, 5-14-2012) 
ARTICLE II. - BOARD OF PUBLIC WORKS 

Secs. 29-6-29-12. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Former  29-6-29-12 were repealed by Ord. No. 3422. 
Sec. 29-13. - Payment of bills and salaries. 
    All bills of the utilities department and all salaries of its employees shall be allowed and paid in the same manner that bills and salaries of the other employees of the city are allowed and paid. 
(2024,  8; 3422) 
Sec. 29-14. - Procedure for contracting for construction; operating waterworks system. 
    The doing of all work and the furnishing of all supplies for the construction, operating and maintaining of the system of waterworks shall be let out by the city council in the same manner as other public work is let out, except in cases where it is not practicable to do such work or furnish such material by contract, and all contracts shall be submitted to the city council for approval; except, that in circumstances wherein a developer or subdivision owner, or other person or firm, desiring water mains and extensions for which such developer or subdivision owner or other person or firm is to pay for such water lines and extensions, the following plan and procedure shall be followed: 
(1)  The city council is hereby authorized to execute contracts for water main extensions, as prescribed in this article. 
(2)  Water main extensions shall include no mains smaller than eight (8) inches in size, and hydrants shall be spaced according to the then existing design criteria of the utilities department; provided, however, that the city council or its designated representative may require: 
a.  The use of smaller mains in areas otherwise provided with fire protection; 
b.  The use of mains larger than eight (8) inches, in which case the city shall bear the difference between the estimated cost of the larger main and an eight-inch main, unless in the judgment of the city council such larger main is required or needed by the applicant for such water main extension. 
The main extension shall include as an integral part thereof such tap or outlet on the existing city-owned main as may be required to permit connection of the main extension to the existing system of the city. 
(3)  All water main extensions shall be constructed by the applicant for the water main extension; provided, however, that the city council, at its discretion, and if in its judgment circumstances so warrant, may arrange for the extension to be constructed by the city by contract awarded on the basis of competitive bids. 
(4)  If the main extension is constructed by the applicant, the applicant or his agent, servant, employee, independent contractor or such other person, firm, partnership, corporation or association by whom such work is to be performed, shall file with the utilities director a construction and maintenance bond approved by the utilities director in an amount equal to the estimated cost of the project, conditioned as required, if bond for public works, and that such work will be done in accordance with the utilities department standard specifications and guaranteeing the work and maintenance of trenches for a period of two (2) years from the date of acceptance of the work. 
Before commencing work upon such project, the applicant or his agent, servant, employee, independent contractor or such other person, firm, partnership, corporation or association by whom such work is to be performed shall also file with the utilities director a certificate or policy of public liability insurance in favor of the city, conditioned to protect and save harmless the city from all claims for damage to property or injury to persons by reason of such construction work, and indemnifying the city on account of such claims or injuries; the surety and amount of said insurance to be approved by the utilities director. 
(5)  Except in unusual circumstances, the detailed plans shall be prepared by a registered professional engineer employed by the applicant. The utilities director, for a water main extension, shall make rules and regulations by which an applicant may accomplish the engineering design of water main extensions by a registered professional engineer in private employment. The contract for a water main extension to be accomplished in accordance with such rules and regulations shall include a deposit of four (4) per cent of the estimated cost of an eight-inch or smaller water extension, as determined by the city council; however, the minimum amount to be deposited shall be the sum of fifty dollars ($50.00), this deposit to be a nonrefundable charge covering the cost of supervision of construction, flushing, chlorination and other overhead costs of the city. 
(6)  If because of such circumstances, the main extension should be designed by the city rather than by the applicant's engineer as provided in the preceding paragraph, the applicant for the water main extension shall deposit with the utilities director, at the time of making application, a sum equal to five (5) per cent of the estimated cost of an eight-inch or smaller water main extension, as determined by a preliminary study by the utilities director; provided, however, the minimum amount to be deposited shall be the sum of fifty dollars ($50.00), this amount to be a nonrefundable charge to the applicant to cover the cost of design. After the plans and specifications for any water main extension have been prepared by the city, the applicant for such extension shall enter into a contract for the construction of such extension and shall make an additional deposit to the city in the amount of fifteen (15) per cent of the estimated cost of an eight-inch or smaller water main extension, less the amount deposited with the application. This additional deposit shall be a nonrefundable charge covering the engineering, design, supervision of construction, flushing, chlorination and other overhead costs of the city. 
(7)  The applicant for any water main extension to be constructed by the city shall make a deposit with the city in an amount equal to the estimated cost of an 8 inch or smaller water main extension, and such estimated cost shall include all costs for materials, labor, transportation, equipment and other costs, but shall include no charge for engineering, administration and other overhead costs as defined above. 
(8)  When the actual cost of any water main extension is known, the city shall refund that part of the applicant's deposit that is in excess of the actual cost. In case the deposit is less than the actual cost, the utilities director may require that the deficiency be made up by an additional deposit to be effected before any connection to the line is made by the applicant. 
(9)  All water main extension contracts authorized by this article shall stipulate that the water mains constructed by the applicant shall be the property of the city, and the control, operation and right of use thereof shall be vested wholly and exclusively in the city; and the applicant for such extension shall have no interest herein other than the right to make connections thereto in accordance with applicable rules and regulations of the utilities department and existing ordinances. 
(10)  Each main extension contract shall stipulate that all construction and installation made in accordance with contracts authorized by this article shall be started within three (3) months and completed within twelve (12) months from the date of such contract, or the city council may, at its option, and upon giving written notice, cancel such contract, in which case any and all deposits shall be forfeited, and any portion of the work which had been completed shall become property of the city. 
(11)  Each main extension contract shall stipulate that the applicant shall not be entitled to refund at any time on account of original customers directly and permanently connected to any water main extension or on account of revenue collected from such customers, except as stated in subsection (m) of this section. 
(12)  Any contract entered into pursuant to this section which may involve reimbursement to the applicant for mains larger than eight (8) inches in diameter shall not be binding upon the city, unless there is affixed thereon at the time of execution a certification by the utilities director that sufficient funds are available to meet the obligation being occurred. 
(13)  No property or lot in the vicinity of any water main built hereafter and pursuant to this ordinance which is not owned by an "applicant" (any person causing a water main to be installed for the benefit of lots or property owned by him) either when the main is constructed or when a water connection is sought for such property or lot shall be directly supplied with water from the main until the sum of four hundred dollars ($400.00) is paid to the city for reimbursement as provided below. This shall be in addition to other connection charges imposed by the city. Such amount shall be paid before any water is supplied from the main constructed. If any existing main is replaced by another main by either the city or any other party, those parties who received water service through the existing main shall not be liable for any charge as a result of subsequently connecting to the larger main. In no event is the applicant or party installing the main to receive more than the actual cost of installing that portion of the line adjacent to non-owned property; and further, as to any portion of the line which also adjoins or adjoined, when built, the applicant's land, the applicant shall receive no more than fifty (50) per cent of the cost of such adjoining portion of line. The applicant shall be entitled to amounts equal to monies collected, payable to him as collected, until the agreed-on estimated or cost of installation, whichever is less, is paid in full. 
    The words developer and owner as used above are to be construed to mean and include developer, subdivision owner, owner and other persons, firms or corporations desiring water main extensions. 
(2024,  10; 3284,  2; 3422) 
Sec. 29-15. - Contract forms, etc. 
    The contract documents as referred to in the previous sections, and the repayment plan as outlined in such contract forms, is hereby authorized, and the city council is hereby directed and empowered to execute such contracts; except, that contracts executed with existing applicants for water main extensions shall, for an additional period of 6 months from the adoption hereof, be in the form and with the provisions of the present ordinances. Any change in procedure or contract form must be approved by the city council. The new contract form shall be as follows: 
"CONTRACT REFERENCE NO. _______ 
"Contract for Water Main Extension 
    "This agreement is made and entered into this _______ day of _______, 19___, by and between the City of Liberty, Missouri, hereinafter sometimes referred to as "city," and _______ hereinafter sometimes referred to as "applicant." (If the job described is to be performed by a contractor and not by applicant, such person shall also be made a party to this contract.) 
"Recitals 
"A.  The estimated cost of the water main extension described herein is _______. 
"B.  If there are "oversize" mains involved in this extension the city's share shall be (if none, so indicate) _______ or actual material cost of the "oversize" portion of the main, whichever is less. 
"C.  If it has been determined that the water main described in this contract will benefit certain property not owned by the applicant and has been further determined that applicant will be entitled to repayment for certain costs involved in the construction on the water main described herein (when and if other connect directly therewith), then a refund schedule initialed by the utilities director and endorsed with the contract reference number of this contract shall be attached as Exhibit "1". Said schedule, if any, includes a plat or sketch of the non-owned property which may benefit and sets out the maximum amount to which applicant shall be entitled. Such schedule also shows to whom any monies collected by the city should be paid and where such payments may be made. 
"D.  The proposed water main is to be located as follows: 
_____
"E.  This contract is entered into for the reason that applicant has applied for a water main extension to be constructed at the location heretofore described. The applicant has made a preliminary study in the drawing of the proposed water main extension and has estimated the cost of the extension as shown above. The utilities director has determined that it is in the best interest of the city to allow applicant to make this installation. 
"Provisions 
    "IT IS HEREBY AGREED BETWEEN THE PARTIES TO THIS AGREEMENT: 
    "1. The applicant (and his contractor, if any) will construct and install the water main extension and appurtenances in accordance with the plans, specifications and drawings attached hereto as Exhibit "2" dated _______ and by reference made a part hereof. This installation shall not be started until after the streets and roads in which the main is to be installed have been graded to the reasonable satisfaction of the utilities director. All work in constructing and installing such extension shall be open to inspection of the utilities department during all phases of the work. Applicant expressly agrees that no backfills on any excavations shall be made until the water mains, extensions, connections, taps, road boxes, cutoff valves and other appurtenances thereto have been approved by an authorized city inspector. 
    2. The city agrees to accept and furnish water to be used in the water main extension and connections thereto subsequent to and conditioned upon: 
    "a. Completion of construction in accordance with water department standards and specifications. 
    "b. Final approval by the utilities director or an authorized representative. 
    "c. Furnishing of a statement signed by the applicant showing the complete actual cost of construction. 
    "d. Furnishing of receipts showing all labor and materials used in connection with such construction as paid. 
    "e. Execution of deeds of dedication to any public streets in the development concerned (if not already dedicated) free and clear of all encumbrances. 
    "f. Execution of a deed to the city covering all water main installations, extensions and connections (to the road box or turn off valve) and other appurtenances, free and clear of all encumbrances. 
    "g. In the event that some portion of the extension is on private property not dedicated to a public use, execution of easements sufficient to permit excavation, replacement, maintenance and repair shall be obtained. 
    3. All water mains and appurtenances installed pursuant to this contract shall be the property of the city. Their control, operation and use shall be vested wholly and exclusively in the city. 
    4. Should the plans and specifications include mains larger than 8 inches, the city will pay its "share" as set forth herein to applicant within ninety (90) days following acceptance of the water main extension by the city. Applicant specifically agrees that this shall be the city's sole cost as far as this main extension is concerned. Applicant expressly agrees that the "estimated cost" referred to heretofore is the estimated cost of the water main extension using only mains that are eight (8) inches or less in diameter. 
    5. It is agreed that in connection with the installation and construction of the extension described, applicant and his contractor, if any, are independent contractors and are in no way acting as agents, servants or employees of the City of Liberty, Missouri. 
    6. Applicant or his contractor shall have liability insurance covering the project described herein of not less than one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) for injuries to a single person and three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00) for multiple personal injuries and one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) for property damage. The city shall be furnished a certificate of insurance and be named as an additional insured in connection with the project. Any insurance policies covering the project shall be standard policies. Upon request a copy of such policies shall be furnished to the city. Applicant or his contractor shall also carry workmen's compensation coverage fully complying with the statutes of Missouri. Evidence that all required insurance has been furnished shall be attached hereto as Exhibit "3".

    8. Applicant and his contractor (if a party to this agreement) agree to indemnify and protect the city and to hold the city harmless from any and all claims by any or all persons, firms or corporations who may hereafter assert any claim of any type arising out of the construction or installation of the water main extension and its appurtenances. Applicant (and his contractor if a party), further agree to indemnify and protect the city for a period of two (2) years after completion and acceptance of the main by the city on account of any repairs and against any defects and shall furnish as Exhibit 4 to this contract a bond from an approved corporate surety guaranteeing performance of this contract, including performance of this provision relating to maintenance and correction of repairs and defects and payment for any and all materials consumed or used in connection with the construction of such work and payment of all insurance premiums in connection with said work and for labor expended thereon which shall comply with RSMo 107.170.

ARTICLE III. - WATER 
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 

Sec. 29-16. - Service installation by city. 
    No water shall be furnished except through a service installation from the main to the property line, parking area or meter, whichever is closer to the main, installed by a licensed plumber or contractor. The customer shall pay to the city at the time of application a system development charge in an amount sufficient to bear a proportionate share of the costs of the system necessary to accommodate new connections. The system development charge shall be based on the schedule of fees in full force and effect, having been approved by the city council and on file in the office of the deputy city clerk. The customer shall pay to the city at the time of application the cost of the service tap and meter as determined and approved by the utilities director or his authorized agent. The cost of the service tap and meter shall be in addition to the system development charge and shall be considered a fee and not a transaction in which the materials are purchased. The ownership of such service line and other appurtenances (installed by a licensed plumber or contractor in accordance with city specifications) installed from the main to the property line, parking area or meter, whichever is closer to the main, shall be considered a part of the water system of the city. The city shall be responsible for the maintenance and repair of all service lines from the main to the property line, parking area or meter, whichever is closer to the main, except that the maximum length of service line for which the city shall be responsible shall be no greater than sixty (60) feet measured from the main. In any case in which a service line must be replaced, the city will perform the necessary work and the property owner shall be responsible for the cost of the materials, including pipe, curb stop and curb box. Materials costs shall be determined by inventory costs plus ten (10) percent. 
(Ord. No. 3749,  1, 12-13-76; Ord. No. 4743,  1, 2, 2-13-84; Ord. No. 5732,  1, 2, 4-24-89; Ord. No. 9068,  I, 12-18-06; Ord. No. 9901,  II, 5-14-2012) 
Sec. 29-17. - Application for water service. 
    All applications for service connections to the distribution pipes of the waterworks for the purpose of introducing water into premises and all applications for service lines and meter installations shall be made in writing to the city engineer by persons desiring such connections, upon appropriate blank forms furnished by the engineering department. Such application shall state fully and truly the purpose for which water is to be used and shall be signed by the applicant. The application shall plainly show the charges to be made for the installation and such charges shall be made for water service by the person in whose name the water bill will be rendered. Application for water service may be made in person or by telephone. The application fee shall be based on the schedule of fees in full force and effect, having been approved by the city council and on file in the office of the deputy city clerk. 
(Ord. No. 2024,  13; Ord. No. 3422; Ord. No. 6141,  1, 5-13-91; Ord. No. 9068,  II, 12-18-06) 
Sec. 29-18. - Payment for service lines; specifications. 
    Each consumer shall pay for his own service line, and such service line shall be installed only by a plumbing contractor who fulfills all of the licensing requirements as established by this Code and is licensed to do business in the City of Liberty. All meter installations shall be located at the direction of the director of community development or his authorized agent, and may include, but shall not be limited to curb line installation and remote reader installations; but in no case shall the city be liable for maintenance of service lines installed on private property. The regulations and specifications for service line installations shall be established by the director of community development [director of utilities] and shall be available upon request in the office of community development [office of the director of utilities] of the city. 
(Ord. No. 2024,  18; Ord. No. 3284,  2; Ord. No. 3422; Ord. No. 4033,  1, 11-20-78; Ord. No. 4132,  1, 7-9-79) 
Sec. 29-19. - Responsibility of city. 
    The city shall not be liable for the breaking of any service line, pipe or fixtures, nor for the unavoidable scarcity of water or failure of pressure, nor for steam boilers or other equipment depending upon the service pipes for feed and water pressure. All connections are made with such understanding. 
(Ord. No. 3422) 
Sec. 29-20. - Action on application. 
    When application for water service shall have been made in the manner described in section 29-17, acceptance of the application will [be] at the discretion of the utilities director. Upon acceptance of the application, the utilities director shall direct the installation of a water meter within twenty-four (24) hours. Installation of water meters during the winter months of December, January, and February shall be at the discretion of the utilities director. At the discretion of the utilities director, builders may be charged the replacement cost of any meters installed during the winter months that freeze. 
(2024,  14; 3422; Ord. No. 7355,  I, 11-12-96; Ord. No. 9901,  II, 5-14-2012) 
Sec. 29-21. - Permit required. 
    No person shall by himself or by any person acting under his authority, use or take water from any part of the waterworks, without a license or permit from the city, or open or hitch to, dig out, cover up or remove any fireplug, hydrant, stopcock valve, valve box or other fixtures appertaining to such waterworks or turn on or shut off water into or from any water pipe wherever situated. 
(2024,  45) 
Sec. 29-22. - Supplying water to others by permittee. 
    Each person supplied with water from the waterworks shall not supply or permit to be supplied other persons with water through his meter except in instances of a multiple dwelling where the owner or manager furnishes water to his tenants. For any violation of this rule, the water shall be turned off from the premises and shall not be turned on again until the payment of a twenty-five dollar ($25.00) penalty, for turning the water off and on during normal business hours, or a fifty dollar ($50.00) penalty, for turning the water off and on at any other time, has been received. 
(2024,  15; Ord. No. 6370,  1, 6-8-92) 
Sec. 29-23. - Use of water for purposes not stated in permit. 
    No person having a license or permit from or agreement with the city for the use of water from the waterworks system of the city shall use or allow water to be used for purposes other than those specified in such permit or agreement with the city. 
    Any consumer of water desiring to use water for any other purpose upon his premises than that defined in his application shall make an amended application defining completely the use he desires to make of the water and receive an amended permit. Failure to secure an amended permit or use of water detrimental to the water system shall be cause for discontinuing service to the premises. 
(2024,  16, 45) 
Sec. 29-24. - Billing. 
    A copy of the city's utilities billing procedures manual is on file in the office of the deputy city clerk. 
(2024,  12; 3422; Ord. No. 9901,  III, 5-14-12) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 9901,  III, adopted May 14, 2012, changed the title of  29-24 from assessment and collection of water rates to billing. 
_____
Sec. 29-25. - Water rates. 
    The following shall be and the same is hereby established as the schedule of meter rates as fixed by the city council of the City of Liberty, Clay County, Missouri, subject to such change from time to time as the city council shall direct: 
(a)  Users inside the city limits: 
WATER RATES 
Effective with January 2019 water usage, the water rates for residential and commercial customers shall be: 
Monthly customer charge $6.73 Volume charges  Minimum volume charge $3.24  1,001 to 2,000 gallons $6.93 per 1,000 gallons  2,001 to 20,000 gallons $5.69 per 1,000 gallons  20,001 to 100,000 gallons $5.16 per 1,000 gallons  Over 100,000 gallons $4.03 per 1,000 gallons  
(b)  Customers outside city. For all water customers outside the legally defined limits of the City of Liberty, the rates shall be that designated in subsection (a) plus ten (10) per cent additional charge, which shall be added to the total bill of each customer as defined herein. 
(c)  Wholesale customers. For all wholesale water customers receiving water service from the City of Liberty, the rate to the wholesale customer shall be set by separate contract.
